newsitem.title: UK: RTZ buys two US coal mines for $99 mln.
newsitem.headline: RTZ buys two US coal mines for $99 mln.

text.p: Anglo-Australian mining group RTZ-CRA said on Tuesday its Kennecott Energy and Coal subsidiary had agreed to buy two U.S. coal mining companies from a Drummond Company Inc unit for $99 million in cash.
RTZ said the buys included the stock and assets of Caballo Rojo Inc and the assets of the Fort Union mine -- with the main operation being Caballo Rojo mine near Gilette, Wyoming.

"Caballo Rojo is the sixth largest coal mine in the United States and produced 13.6 million tonnes of coal in 1996 from a reserve base of 318 million tonnes," the company said in a statement issued in London.

The nearby Fort Union coal mine produced 0.91 million tonnes in 1996. After the acquisition, total Kennecott Energy production will increase from 41 million tonnes to over 56 million tonnes and the unit's total reserves will rise to 1.3 billion tonnes, it added.
"This is a tremendous opportunity for Kennecott Energy to add another highly productive Powder River Basin mine to our portfolio," said Kennecott Energy President, Greg Boyce.
Kennecott Energy Company, through its affiliates, is the fourth largest coal producer in the United States.
